properties.otherAdvice:
NRL & NRLW Double Header at WIN Stadium. NRLW: Dragons v Titans kick off at 12pm, NRL: Dragons v Panthers kick off at 2pm, full time at around 4pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St as fans travel to and from the game.

Local roads around the stadium may close before, during and after the game for the safety of pedestrians.

Fans driving to the game on the freeway are encouraged to use the Masters Rd exit to avoid congestion at Mount Ousley Rd, both in and out of Wollongong.

Motorists should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Harbour Street

properties.otherAdvice:
NRLW: Wests Tigers v Canberra Raiders at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. Kick-off from 1.45pm, full time around 3.45pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual as fans travel to the stadium. Allow extra travel time on roads including Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd.

Motorists should also be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive

properties.otherAdvice:
IVE at Qudos Bank Arena. Start time 7.30pm, finish around 10.30pm.

Traffic may be heavy on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park while attendees travel to and from the precinct. Allow extra travel time on the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Attendees who need to drive should pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space - available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Avoid the traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Dr roundabout and use Silverwater Rd, Holker St and Hill Rd to access car parks.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close some local roads to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, see the Sydney Olympic Park interactive map.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Roosters v Sea Eagles at Allianz Stadium. Kick-off at 7.35pm, full time around 9.35pm.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 5.30pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave. Access to EP3 grass car park and drop off areas maintained from Lang Rd. EP2 will not be open for this match.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm to 11pm on sections of Albion St, Fitzroy St and Moore Park Rd, and from 6am to 11pm on Cleveland St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: Sydney Swans v Western Bulldogs at the SCG. First bounce at 3.20pm, full time around 6pm.

With up to 40,000 fans expected, traffic will be heavy on roads approaching Moore Park as fans travel to and from the match.

Motorists are urged to avoid unnecessary travel in the area before and after the game as delays are expected. Allow extra travel time on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde, Oxford St and Lang Rd.

Changed traffic conditions:

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the SCG from 12.30pm and will reopen after the game. No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave.
  • Access to EP2 car park will be maintained from Moore Park Rd and access to EP3 grass car park and drop-off areas will be maintained from Lang Rd. Car parks open from 12.30pm.
  • Due to the Moore Park Rd pop up cycleway, there is no left-turn permitted from Lang Rd onto Moore Park Rd westbound. Motorists can use Cook Rd for access onto Moore Park Rd instead.  

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 11am to 8pm on sections of Albion St, Fitzroy St and Moore Park Rd, and from 6am to 8pm on Cleveland St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Wests Tigers v Cowboys at Leichhardt Oval. Kick-off from 7:50pm and full time around 9:50pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Mary St, Glover St, Perry St, Lilyfield Rd and Balmain Rd as attendees travel to and from the match during evening peak.

Mary St may be partially closed at the oval before the game to allow attendees to safely arrive and leave the venue after the game. Local detours via Chapel St will be in place.

Motorists requiring access to other venues in the park should use either Maliyawul St or Glover St.

Attendees driving to the game should allow extra travel time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Mary Street

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Sharks v Rabbitohs at PointsBet Stadium in Woolooware. Kick-off at 5.20pm, full time around 9.25pm.

Road closures may be in place on Captain Cook Dr from approximately 10 minutes before kick-off and remain in place until crowds have cleared around 30 minutes after full-time.

Traffic on roads approaching the stadium will be heavier than usual as fans travel to the match. Allow extra travel time on Captain Cook Dr, Woolooware Rd and Gannons Rd. 

Motorists should also be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

roads.mainStreet: Captain Cook Drive

properties.otherAdvice:
Hot Wheels Monster Truck Live Glow Party at Qudos Bank Arena. Start time Saturday 11:30am & 6pm, Start time Sunday 11:30am.

Traffic may be heavy on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park while attendees travel to and from the precinct. Allow extra travel time on the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Attendees who need to drive should pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space - available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Avoid the traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Dr roundabout and use Silverwater Rd, Holker St and Hill Rd to access car parks.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close some local roads to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, see the Sydney Olympic Park interactive map.

properties.otherAdvice:
NRLW double header at Allianz Stadium. Eels v Sharks kick-off at 12pm, Roosters v Broncos kick-off at 1.45pm. Full-time approx 3.25pm.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

EP2 & EP3 grass car parks will not be open for this match. Driver Ave will remain open, with parking for permit holders only.

Parking is available at the Entertainment Quarter Wilson car park, entry via Errol Flynn Blvd from Lang Rd. A flat rate fee applies.

NRL: Panthers v Knights at BlueBet Stadium. NRL kick-off at 2pm, full time approx. 4pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Mulgoa Rd, Jamison Rd and Jane St/Great Western Hwy through Penrith as thousands of fans travel to the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

NRL Bulldogs v Raiders. Preliminary game from 1.30pm. NRL kick-off from 4.05pm. Finish around 6pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching Belmore Sports Ground as fans make their way to the game.

Parking is limited on local streets and car parks in the area. 

Attendees driving to the game should be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads

properties.otherAdvice:
The Holden Day Car Show will be held at Hawkesbury Showground in Clarendon from Saturday 3 to Sunday 4 August. The show starts daily at 6am and finishes at 5pm on Saturday and 2pm on Sunday.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads including Hawkesbury Valley Way, Blacktown Rd, The Northern Rd and Richmond Rd approaching the Precinct as families travel to the showground over the weekend.

Heavy traffic is expected in Clarendon and surrounding suburbs approaching the showground. Attendees travelling to the show are encouraged to catch trains instead to avoid delays.

roads.mainStreet: Hawkesbury Valley Way, Blacktown Road, The Northern Road, Richmond Road

properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting while roads are closed. Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Around 7,000 people will take part in the annual Sydney Harbour 10k and 5k.

Events start from George St in The Rocks from 7:30am. The course travels around the harbour foreshore using on and off-road pathways via Dawes Point, Millers Point, Barangaroo, King St Wharf , Darling Harbour and Pyrmont. To safely facilitate the event, road closures will be in place.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and follow directions of traffic controllers on site.

ROAD CLOSURES:

  • 4am to 1pm: Circular Quay West at the OPT
  • 4:30am to 11am: George St from Alfred St to Hickson Rd, Hickson Rd from George St to Park Hyatt, and the OPT Upper Roadway
  • 6am to 10am: Hickson Rd between Napoleon St and Barton St, Sussex St between Napoleon St and Erskine St, northbound lanes of Sussex St from King St to Erskine St. Sections of Slip St and Barton St.
  • 6am to 11am: Hickson Rd from Park Hyatt to Barton St, Napoleon St between Kent St and Sussex St, and sections of Dalgety Rd and Towns Pl.
  • 7.30am to 10am: Sections of Murray St and Pirrama Rd, and Wharf 7/10 Access Rd in Pyrmont. Access the Star via Edward St, no access via Pirrama Rd.
  • Changed access - 8.30am to 9:30am: Due to the closure of Sussex St there is no exit from King St Wharf/Barangaroo South. Entry via Harbour St and Wheat Rd only. Roads affected include Barangaroo Ave, Cuthbert St, Erskine St, King St, Lime St, Shelley St and Watermans Quay.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on public transport is covered for participants & volunteers. Buses between the city and the Eastern Suburbs will be diverting and using different stops while roads are closed. Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Significant road closures and widespread parking restrictions will be in place between the Sydney CBD and Bondi Beach while 90,000 people take part in the 14km City2Surf fun run.

Key roads around the start area in Hyde Park in the Sydney CBD start closing from as early as 3.30am with major roads closing along the course from 6am from the city to the Eastern Suburbs. Heavy traffic is expected while roads are closed, so avoid unnecessary travel or expect delays and allow plenty of extra travel time on the roads.

Roads begin progressively reopening from 11.30am in the city, 12pm at Edgecliff, 1pm at Rose Bay, 2pm at Vaucluse & Dover Heights and 4pm at Bondi Beach.

MAJOR ROAD CLOSURES

  • Sydney CBD between 3.30pm and 12pm: sections of College St, Macquarie St, Park St and St James Rd.
  • Woolloomooloo to Edgecliff from 6am to 12pm midday: William St from Yurong St through to New South Head Rd at Ocean Ave. No access to the city via New South Head Rd west of Ocean St until 12pm, use alternative route via Oxford St.
  • The Cross City Tunnel will be closed eastbound, access to Cross City Tunnel and Craigend St (westbound direction only) is maintained via McLachlan Ave at Rushcutters Bay. From the Eastern Distributor there is no access to William St or the Cross City Tunnel westbound.
  • Double Bay to Rose Bay from 7am to 1pm: New South Head Rd from Ocean Ave to Dover Rd.
  • Rose Bay to North Bondi from 7am to 2pm: New South Head Rd from Dover Rd to Old South Head Rd, Old South Head Rd from New South Head Rd to Oceanview Ave, and Military Rd from Old South Head Rd to Blair St.
  • Bondi Beach between 6am and 4pm: Campbell Pde from Hall St to Blair St closed from 6am and Campbell Pde from Dudley St to Hall St and Lamrock Ave, sections of Wairoa Ave, Hastings Pde and Wallis Pde closed from 7am. on Queen Elizabeth Drive, Park Drive North and South at Bondi Beach will be closed from 1pm Saturday until 4pm Sunday and special event clearways will be in effect from 1am Sunday. This also applies to residents with Beach Parking Permits
  • Bondi Junction from 9am to 4pm: sections of Grafton St, Grosvenor St and Oxford St around Bondi Junction

Crossover points along the course will be maintained for local residents to cross the course until 7am or 7.10am, depending on the location. After these times there will be no vehicle access permitted while the run is underway until roads have safely reopened to traffic.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect along both sides of the 14km course from 1am to 12pm from the city to Rose Bay and from 1am until 4pm along the remainder of the course to Bondi Beach.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

arrangementElements.html:
Crossover points along the course will be maintained for local access until 7am or 7.10am, depending on the location. After these times there will be no vehicle access permitted while the run is underway until roads have safely reopened to traffic.

Vehicle course crossover points:

  • Woolloomooloo/Darlinghurst: Crown St at William St two-way crossover open until 7:10am. Kings Cross precinct access will also be maintained via Darlinghurst Rd, Victoria St, and Ward Ave throughout the event.
  •  Darling Point: Exit only southbound from New Beach Rd to Neild Ave open until 7am. No entry after 7am.
  •  Double Bay to Edgecliff: Exit only southbound from Ocean Ave to Ocean St open until 7:10am. No entry after 7am. 
  • Double Bay to Bellevue Hill: Exit only southbound from Cross St to Bellevue Rd at New South Road until 7:10am. No entry after 7am.
  • Vaucluse/Rose Bay: Towns Rd / Vaucluse Rd at New South Head Rd two-way crossover open until 7:10am. No entry after 7am.
  • Vaucluse/Watsons Bay: Exit only one-way from Old South Head Rd at New South Head Rd until 7:10am. No entry after 7am.
  • North Bondi/Bondi Beach: Exit only one-way from Brighton Blvd at Campbell Pde and at Ramsgate Ave open until 7am, No entry after 6am.

Local access

  • Bondi Rd - will be heavily congested with hundreds of buses transporting thousands of participants between the beach and the junction. Local residents are strongly encouraged to avoid unnecessary travel on Bondi Rd. Residents north of Bondi Rd should use Old South Head Rd to enter or exit the area via Blair Street. Residents south of Bondi Rd should use Birrell St.
  • Bondi Beach - Local access for properties at Bondi Beach will be maintained via one-way traffic only, entry via Curlewis, Gould and Hall Streets one-way. Properties between Lamrock Ave and Hall St exit onto Hall St only, no access to or from Lamrock Ave.
  • Dover Heights – managed access will be available for properties on Military Rd between Lancaster Rd and Blake St from 5am to 7am only.
  • Cross City Tunnel westbound - Access to Cross City Tunnel and Craigend St (westbound direction only) is maintained via McLachlan Ave at Rushcutters Bay. The tunnel will be closed eastbound until 12pm midday.
arrangementElements.title: Vehicle Crossover Points & Local Access Changes

roads.mainStreet: William St, New South Head Rd, Old South Head Rd, Military Rd & Campbell Pde

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip. The Hordern Pavilion at Moore Park is easily accessible by light rail and buses.
properties.otherAdvice:
The City2Surf Expo will be held at the Hordern Pavilion in Moore Park from 8 to 10 August.

  • Thursday 8 August from 12pm midday to 7pm
  • Friday 9 August from 8am to 6:30pm
  • Saturday 10 August 7:30am to 4:30pm 

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching and around Moore Park on these dates including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Moore Park will be especially busy on Friday 9 August with AFL kicking off at nearby SCG at 7:40pm. Please allow extra travel time and if you are driving, expect delays in the area and be aware of special event clearway parking restrictions. Driver Avenue will be partially closed before the game and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game at SCG.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until midnight on Friday 9 August including sections of Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St and Cleveland St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

  • Moore Park Road between Cook Road and Poate Road (southern side)

properties.otherAdvice:
A funeral service will be held at Gilgandra Shire Council Hall for Mr Geoffrey Bruce Kiehne (NSW SES Gilgandra Unit) on Tuesday 30 July 2024. The Oxley Hwy will be closed from the Newell Hwy to Waugan St. A detour will be in place throughout the funeral.

Light vehicle will detour via Newell Hwy and Willii St

Heavy vehicle will detour via Newell Hwy and Hargraves Ln

roads.mainStreet: Oxley Highway

properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting while roads are closed for the Beach2Beach fun run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Around 5,000 participants will take part in the annual Beach2Beach Charity Fun Run and Festival from Dee Why to Newport. Events start from 8am and will finish at around 1pm at Newport Beach. Changed traffic conditions will be in effect along the course for the safety of participants. Access for local residents will be maintained when safe to do so after runners have safely passed by along the course.

  • Collaroy from 7am to 9:30am: Sections of Beach Road and Florence Avenue will be closed to general traffic.
  • Warriewood/Mona Vale from 7.30am to 11am:
  • Narrabeen Park Parade southbound lanes will be closed between Cook Terrace and Sydney Road, Warriewood. One-way traffic northbound only will be maintained.
  • Sections of Melbourne Avenue, Basset Street, Orana Road and Surfview Road will be closed.
  • Peal Place and Bruce Street will be under managed access for residents via Narrabeen Park Parade northbound.
  • Mona Vale from 7.30am to 12pm: Grandview Parade will be closed between Orana Road and Barrenjoey Road.
  • Newport from 7.30am to 12:30pm: Sections of Ross Street, Palm Road and Myola Road around the Beach will be closed.

Southbound lane closures and a reduced speed limit of 40km/h will also be in place on sections of Barrenjoey Road and Pittwater Road while the event takes place.

Special event clearways will be in place from 4am to midday on the eastern side of Barrenjoey Road between Palm Road (Newport) and Grandview Parade (Mona Vale), and from 4am to 9:30am on the eastern side of Pittwater Road between Anzac Avenue (Collaroy) and Hawkesbury Avenue (Dee Why).

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:
Road closures affect both directions unless stated otherwise. Roads will be progressively reopen after cleaning  


COLLAROY – FROM 7AM TO 9.30AM

  • Beach Rd* between Anzac Ave and Collaroy Beach
  • Florence Ave* from Beach Rd

WARRIEWOOD/MONA VALE – FROM 7:30AM TO 11AM

  • Bruce St and Pearl Pl will be under managed access from Narrabeen Park Pde
  • Melbourne Ave^^ between Cook Tce and Narrabeen Park Pde
  • Narrabeen Park Parade** between Cook Tce and Sydney Rd (south) (Southbound)
  • Peal Pl - managed access from Narrabeen Park Pde
  • Bassett St* From Orana Rd (Eastbound)
  • Orana Rd^ between Bassett St and Grandview Pde (Northbound)
  • Surfview Rd* between Bassett St and Seabeach Ave
  • Surfview Rd* From Darley St E to end of street

MONA VALE – FROM 7:30AM TO 12PM

  • Grandview Pde^ between Barrenjoey Rd and Orana Rd (Eastbound)

NEWPORT – FROM 7:30AM TO 12.30PM

Restricted access is in place from Barrenjoey Rd northbound to Newport Beach and on the eastern side of Barrenjoey Rd between Karloo Parade and The Boulevarde. Residents are advised to expect minor delays.

  • Myola Rd* between Ross St and Palm Rd (Southbound)
  • Palm Rd* between Barrenjoey Rd and Myola Rd (Westbound)
  • Ross St* between Bramley Ave and Myola Rd (Northbound)

NOTES:

*Managed access for residents will be in place and minor delays expected.

^Resident will have access via Bassett St and should expect minor delays.

**Residents will have access via Narrabeen Park Parade in the northbound direction.

^^Route Buses excepted.


LANE CLOSURES – BARRENJOEY ROAD

Managed access for residents will be in place with minor delays expected. Temporary lane closures will be progressively reopen after cleaning.


COLLAROY TO DEE WHY

  • FROM 6AM TO 10AM: Pittwater Rd Between Anzac Ave and Hawkesbury Ave – Lane 1 & 2

NEWPORT TO MONA VALE

  • 6AM TO 11AM: Barrenjoey Rd between Hillcrest Ave and Grandview Pde – Lane 1 & 2 (Southbound)
  • 6AM TO 12PM: Barrenjoey Rd between Palm Rd and Grandview Pde – Lane 1 (Southbound)

40KM/H SPEED REDUCTION

A reduced speed limit of 40km/h will apply in the following areas to ensure the safety of runners:

  • 6AM TO 10AM: Pittwater Rd Between Anzac Ave and Hawkesbury Ave
  • 6AM TO 12PM: Barrenjoey Rd between between The Boulevard and Grandview Pde (Southbound)

roads.mainStreet: Pittwater Road, Ocean Street and Barrenjoey Road

properties.otherAdvice: 2024 marks the 80th Anniversary of the Cowra Breakout. This year's commemorations will take place over the 4 & 5 August in Cowra. A 40kph speed reduction approaching Cowra Cemetery on Canowindra Rd and Doncaster Drive will be in place on Monday 5 August between 8.30am and 11.30am.

roads.mainStreet: Canowindra Rd

properties.otherAdvice:
The Casino Truck Show will be held Saturday 3 August from 9.30am to 12pm. Centre St will be closed Southbound to light vehicles only between Johnston St and Richmond St. Traffic lights and controllers will be present either side of the Casino Dr with traffic held in 5 minute intervals on Johnston St.

There will be regular 10 minute stoppages between 10am and 12pm to allow the parade to proceed.

roads.mainStreet: Centre Street

properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Eels v Storm at CommBank Stadium. NRL kick-off at 8pm, full time around 9.45pm.

Traffic may be heavy on roads approaching and within Parramatta as fans travel to the game. Allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd.

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium.

Roads outside the stadium will close from 9:30pm to 10:15pm to allow crowds to safely leave the venue. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

Be patient leaving car parks as traffic will be heavy and follow the directions of traffic controllers and Police.

roads.mainStreet: O'Connell Street

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Sharks v Cowboys at PointsBet Stadium in Woolooware. Kick-off at 11.05am, full time around 1pm.

Road closures may be in place on Captain Cook Dr from approximately 10 minutes before kick-off and remain in place until crowds have cleared around 30 minutes after full-time.

Traffic on roads approaching the stadium will be heavier than usual as fans travel to the match. Allow extra travel time on Captain Cook Dr, Woolooware Rd and Gannons Rd. 

Motorists should also be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

roads.mainStreet: Captain Cook Drive

properties.publicTransport: Light rail services run regularly. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Industry Celebration Day at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race at 11am, last race at 4.25pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as crowds travel to the races.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads, and high volumes of taxi and rideshare pick ups and drop offs.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street
